result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J. Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Marcus J. Decorah appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Atty. ORourke represents in prior case 13CM676.  State represents that DE appearing on 13CM676 to order booking that he was suppose to do prior and did not.  State requests $5000.00 Cash bond and reiterates M. Decorahs background on non appearances and warrants/cash bonds in many different counties.  Atty. Woodard requests reasonable cash in range of $750.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $5000.00 CASH bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
